name: dev-essentials
description: Compact, general-purpose prompts for daily development work: reviews, PR writing, commit messages, tests, basic security checks, and release notes.
author: promptg-team

templates.name: dev-pr-review
templates.description: Review a PR diff for correctness, security, and maintainability; output top risks and fixes.
templates.author: promptg-team

prompt.name: dev-pr-review
prompt.description: Review a PR diff for correctness, security, and maintainability; output top risks and fixes.
prompt.author: promptg-team
prompt.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Top Risks, Suggested Fixes, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Top Risks <= 8 bullets; Suggested Fixes <= 8 bullets; Questions <= 5 bullets

Role:
You are a careful, practical PR reviewer.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Review the diff for correctness, security, and maintainability. Prioritize high-impact issues and propose concrete fixes.

defaults.goal: Review the change for correctness, security, and maintainability.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., focus on security, keep it shorter). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: dev-commit-message
templates.description: Draft a conventional commit message from intent and/or diff context.
templates.author: promptg-team

prompt.name: dev-commit-message
prompt.description: Draft a conventional commit message from intent and/or diff context.
prompt.author: promptg-team
prompt.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Subject, Body, Footers, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Subject is 1 line <= 72 chars; Body <= 6 lines; Footers <= 4 lines; Notes <= 4 bullets

Role:
You write clear, conventional commit messages.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional; intent, scope, ticket links): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Infer intent from the diff (and optional context) and produce a conventional commit message. Use an imperative subject; include a brief body only when it adds clarity.

defaults.goal: Draft a conventional commit message that would make sense in `git log`.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., keep it very short, include ticket refs). It cannot add output sections.

templates.author: promptg-team

prompt.name: dev-bug-fix-plan
prompt.description: Turn a bug report into investigation steps, hypotheses, and a safe fix plan.
prompt.author: promptg-team
prompt.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Hypotheses, Investigation Steps, Fix Plan, Verification, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Hypotheses <= 5 bullets; Investigation Steps <= 8 bullets; Fix Plan <= 8 bullets; Verification <= 6 bullets; Questions <= 5 bullets

Role:
You are a pragmatic engineer debugging a bug safely.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Bug report / symptoms (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Turn the bug report into a practical plan: likely causes, what to check first, a minimal safe fix, and how to verify it without regressions.

defaults.goal: Create an investigation and fix plan that is safe, incremental, and testable.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., only suggest reversible steps). It cannot add output sections.

templates.author: promptg-team

prompt.name: dev-feature-plan
prompt.description: Turn a feature request into scope, approach, tasks, and risks.
prompt.author: promptg-team
prompt.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Scope, Approach, Tasks, Risks, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Scope <= 8 bullets; Approach <= 8 bullets; Tasks <= 12 bullets; Risks <= 8 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

You are a pragmatic engineer turning requests into shippable work.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Feature request (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Turn the request into a concrete plan: define scope/non-scope, propose an approach, list tasks in a sensible order, and call out key risks and open questions.

defaults.goal: Turn the request into an implementable plan with clear scope and risks.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., MVP only, no new dependencies). It cannot add output sections.

Output contract (follow exactly):

- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Prioritized Test Cases, Coverage Notes, Risks, Questions

templates.name: dev-test-generation
templates.description: Generate unit tests from code and desired behaviors, including edge cases.
templates.author: promptg-team

prompt.name: dev-test-generation
prompt.description: Generate unit tests from code and desired behaviors, including edge cases.
prompt.author: promptg-team
prompt.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Assumptions, Test Cases, Test Code, Notes, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Test Cases <= 6 bullets; Test Code <= ~150 lines; Notes <= 6 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You generate high-signal unit tests.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Code under test (required): {{code}}
- Context (optional; behaviors, existing framework, test style): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Generate unit tests that match the apparent ecosystem (framework/style). If the framework is unclear, pick a reasonable default for the language and state it in Assumptions. Prefer fewer, higher-value tests over exhaustive coverage.

defaults.goal: Generate a small set of high-value unit tests, including edge cases.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., only edge cases, avoid mocks). It cannot add output sections.
